page.title: 13INDUSTRY AND RECREATION
page.content: { Industry}and{Recreation ----------------------------------- Thurlby{Quarry}is one of a chain of gravel pits following gravel deposited by the River Trent on a former course. Work began in November 1969 using two methods, excavating the banks and dredging the bottom by suction.High quality Quartzite gravel is produced and transported by lorry for use in concrete constructions. The lake is used at Weekends for leisure activities,Windsurfing being the main{sport. The life expectancy of the pit is 12 years.After use the area is landscaped, with the banks shaped and trees planted. In recent years this expance of water has attracted numerous wildfowl. --------------------------------------
